pullRequest.body:
This PR adds more analogues of operations on `Fin` tuples to the `Finsupp` setting. Before, there were only `Finsupp.cons` and `Finsupp.tail`. Now there are also `Finsupp.snoc`, `Finsupp.insertNth`, `Finsupp.init`, and `Finsupp.removeNth`. These all come with supporting lemmas.

I also removed the porting comment about `succAboveCases` in `Data/Fin/Basic`, and added a lemma about `succAbove` in `Data/Fin/Tuple/Basic`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #20361
- [x] depends on: #20771 
- [x] depends on: #20770

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (0.05, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|4382|-1|porting notes|
|4879|1|exceptions for the docPrime linter|

Current commit [4b48077c14](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/4b48077c147e3c0635d92948cec9a82a6fd11c9c)
Reference commit [be0cb5462d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/be0cb5462d0a41d900a692b554359fb0f19e91b6)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

My use case is a bit indirect; it's in generalizing `MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv` to work on an arbitrary pivot:
```
def MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv' (p : Fin (n + 1)) :
    MvPolynomial (Fin (n + 1)) R ‚âÉ‚Çê[R] Polynomial (MvPolynomial (Fin n) R) :=
  (renameEquiv R (_root_.finSuccEquiv' p)).trans (optionEquivLeft R (Fin n))
```

As I tried to prove theorems about this definition, I realized I needed the `Finsupp` definition of `insertNth`. And from there I figured might as well add all the variants.

Ah, then may I suggest that you generalise `finSuccEquiv` even more? The most general version wouldn't mention `Fin` at all, but rather two types `Œ±` and `Œ≤`, a map `f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤` as well as an element `b : Œ≤` and a proof that `Set.range f = {b}·∂ú`
I see, yeah I can do that. Is there a name for this set-theoretic equivalence already in Mathlib?
Not sure, no. Also please ask people's opinions on Zulip before you actually try implementing my idea

I've fixed the pivot variable naming. To your point about generalizing `MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv`, I think that there is already a good generalization available: 
```
MvPolynomial.optionEquivLeft: MvPolynomial (Option S‚ÇÅ) R ‚âÉ‚Çê[R] Polynomial (MvPolynomial S‚ÇÅ R)
```
and in fact `MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv` uses this definition.

Yes, I am aware of this `Option` thinb, but somehow you still have to identify `Fin (n + 1)` with `Option (Fin n)` in various ways to get what you want, meaning that you would still need the extra definitions in this PR. I was hoping we could bypass all of that
Can you merge master to reduce the diff?

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20361~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20771~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20770~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

For this PR, I added the four new definitions, and also restructure the theorems afterward to be about removing ops first (`init`, `snoc`, `removeNth`), then concatenating ops (`cons`, `snoc`, `insertNth`).

This leads to some existing theorems being moved around and marked as new even though they are not. Besides these, all new theorems in this PR are about the new definitions. There is also the rewrite for `MvPolynomial/Equiv` to change the variable ordering / implicitness.

So the new definitions are `init`, `removeNth`, `snoc`, `insertNth`. There are still plenty of new lemmas that seemingly don't depend on those four definitions. Could you split those out to a separate PR?

PS: I don't know how you went about splitting your PRs off so far, but an easy way of implementing what I'm asking (which is just a restatement of https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19315#pullrequestreview-2486486693 btw) is to delete the four new definitions and iteratively remove everything that subsequently breaks.
What's your use case?
For ease of reviewing, could you split off to a dependency PR all lemmas that don't rely on those new definitions?

So the new definitions are `init`, `removeNth`, `snoc`, `insertNth`. There are still plenty of new lemmas that seemingly don't depend on those four definitions. Could you split those out to a separate PR?

PS: I don't know how you went about splitting your PRs off so far, but an easy way of implementing what I'm asking (which is just a restatement of https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19315#pullrequestreview-2486486693 btw) is to delete the four new definitions and iteratively remove everything that subsequently breaks.

Please always try calling `p` the first argument to `succAbove`, as its the **p**ivot and doesn't play the same role at all as the second argument.
```suggestion
theorem eq_self_or_eq_succAbove (p i : Fin (n + 1)) : i = p ‚à® ‚àÉ j, i = p.succAbove j :=
```
Here and everywhere else

```suggestion
theorem tail_apply : tail s j = s j.succ := rfl
```
I think it's worth splitting anyway. Thanks üôè

```suggestion
    sum (insertNth p i œÉ) f = f p i + sum œÉ (Fin.removeNth p f) := by
```

```suggestion
    ‚àè i, insertNth p x f i = x * ‚àè i, f i := by
```
Looks out of scope for this PR
New PR created #20770
Can you make this a separate PR?
Here it is #20771
Eg all these
These
These are the same as before (`cons_zero`, `cons_succ`, `tail_cons`), modulo moving `rfl` to the same line, and restructuring of the lemmas (see my comment below).

pullRequest.title: feat(Data/Finsupp/Fin): Add `Finsupp` operations on `Fin` tuple
